lines.content: # I would like to join this list. How can I help the project
For more information, please refer to our [contributor's guide](https://oss-generic.github.io/process/).
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are
instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code
editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the
**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move
Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle)

* Command to mark or unmark a task by its 1-based index.
* Validates input, updates the task status, persists the change, and prints confirmation.
* Executes the mark/unmark operation on a task identified by its 1-based index.

*

The index is read from the command argument. The method validates the index,
* updates the task's done status, persists the change, and prints a confirmation.
* @param taskList the list of tasks to update
* @param ui       the UI used to print messages
* @param storage  persistence used when updating tasks
* @throws MissingTaskNumberException    if no index was provided
* @throws TaskNumberOutOfRangeException if the index is outside {@code [1, taskList.size()]}
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws Exception {
assert ui != null : "UI cannot be null";
assert taskList != null : "TaskList cannot be null";
assert storage != null : "Storage cannot be null";
assert arg != null : "Input cannot be null";
System.out.println(isDone ? "Got it. I have marked this task as done."
: "Got it. I have marked this task as undone.");
* Command to save task as todo.

assert taskList != null : "TaskList cannot be null";

* Thrown when a deadline command is missing the required {@code /by} parameter.
super("When is your task due by? Did you forget?");
* Thrown when a deadline command is missing its description.
super("Deadline must have a description. Add it in now!");
* Thrown when the user submits an empty command line.
* Thrown when an operation requiring tasks fails because the list is empty.
super("Your list is empty. Add something in now!");
* Thrown when an event command is missing its description.
* Thrown when an event command is missing the required {@code /from} parameter.
super("When is the start date and time?");
* Thrown when an event command is missing the required {@code /to} parameter.
super("When does it end? Can you tell me? (o u O)");
* Thrown when a command that requires a task number is issued without one.
* Base type for all domain-specific exceptions in Sunday.
* Thrown when a task that is already marked done is asked to be marked again.
super("Task " + n + " is already marked as " + (done ? "done." : "undone."));
* Thrown when a provided 1-based task index is outside the valid range.
super("No such task: " + n + ". Use a number between 1 and " + size + ".");
* Thrown when a todo command is missing its description.
super("Todo cannot be left blank. Please describe your task.");
* Thrown when the parser cannot recognise the user's command.
super("Hey! That is not a command I know. Try again! (^.v.^)");
